channel.title: New to Xubuntu, I need some help please
channel.description:
I'm new to Linux, so I need some help. Don't ask me why I chose Xubuntu before trying ubuntu or Kubuntu (which is probably why it will be hard to answer some of my questions), I just wanted to try one and I thought Xubuntu was better or something, IDK. Any way, I need to figure out how to take a screen shot. First I press the Prnt Screen button, then i open Gimp, finally I paste it. Only problem, when I paste it, nothing happens.
I also need windows media player so than I can run movies that are on the Internet but i don't know if there is a way to get one for linux. I don't want to keep switching OS's just to watch a movie or a 30 second video clip on the internet (it takes longer to boot and load up than the movie itself, only for me to switch back to linux).

item.title: New to Xubuntu, I need some help please
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:10, topic:95268”]That is correct.

VLC is what you want to play wmp files.[/quote]

or you could just use the default one that comes with Ubuntu and then just use this small tutorial.
How to install Multimedia Codecs

Read full topic
item.source: New to Xubuntu, I need some help please

item.title: New to Xubuntu, I need some help please
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Applications-Settings-UI Preferences in XFCE/Xubuntu.

Applications-Settings-Settings Manager has a huge amount of tweaks you may want to play with, one of the beauties of XFCE is that you can customise it and end up with a desktop tailored to your needs.

Read full topic

item.source: New to Xubuntu, I need some help please

item.title: New to Xubuntu, I need some help please
item.dc:creator: @deoxys505 deoxys505
item.description:
@deoxys505 wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:15, topic:95268”][quote author=deoxys505 link=topic=137720.msg1331534#msg1331534 date=1179434926]

Xubuntu is a lightweght version and mey not support everything, just do ubuntu or Kubuntu if your computer allows it.

That’s bs, Xubuntu supports everything Ubuntu does, they are the same OS just with a different Window Manager and tools.

That is correct.

VLC is what you want to play wmp files.

No, I’m talking about in FF. like movies on the web and stuff. I dont want to switch operating systems to watch 30 second clips on the web; or movies on the web either…

P.S. I want to keep working with linux to get better at using it. I’m proficient with Windows, thats why I switched…

[/quote]

The only firefox plugin that I know of is the Totem Movie Player one, give that a whirl.[/quote]it work for WMP movies?

Read full topic

item.source: New to Xubuntu, I need some help please

item.title: New to Xubuntu, I need some help please
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

to install the multiverse repository, open up your command prompt and type

sudo mousepad /etc/apt/sources.list

it’s either /etc/apt/ or /etc/aptitude,

In there, remove the

#

that’s on the same line that says multiverse

There is no WMP addons for FF, as that’s waaay to proprietary for Linux, however, to install WinE, simply type in

sudo apt-get install wine

Read full topic
